text: What are certain rules of thumb you have learnt while working on Hibernate.
As Hibernate is mostly about mappings (or may be I find that the hardest part), could you please share some best practices that were helpful to you in proper mappings of table relationships.
For example, when to map using "join" and when not, when would you be "eager" or "lazy" etc.
Any other advice/experiences are also welcome as how you improved performance (with or without caching) and avoided some common pitfalls.
Motive is to go through some real life experiences that inspire and help faster learning of important (practical) aspects of Hibernate.
